intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium polycaulodes, commonly known as the many-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves and multiple flowering stems that rise from the center. The flowers are typically yellow and arranged in dense, disc-like clusters, typical of the Compositae family. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
